sub_title: Associate professor Health Communication at University of Amsterdam
summary:
The integration of innovative strategies such as computer-tailored eHealth interventions into the (primary) care setting is one of my main research interests. Besides, I am very interested in the construct of motivation and in how to optimize the motivation to change health related behavior, so that it will be translated into actual health behavior change.

Specialties: web-based, lifestyle, intervention, computer-tailoring, primary care, motivation

education.field_of_study: Public Health: Health Education and Health Promotion
Public Health: Public Health Issues, Alcohol and Substance Abuse

awards.title: Early Career Award
awards.description: The EHPS Early Career Award aims to recognize outstanding research excellence, contributions made to the EHPS and/or contributions to professional practice made by EHPS members within 5 years of their PhD. The award was received during the opening ceremony of the annual EHPS conference in Padua, Italy.

profile_positions.description: As a postdoctoral researcher, I worked on a project entitled ‘From extrinsic to intrinsic motivation to quit smoking’, for which I was granted personal funding by the School for Public Health and Primary Care CAPHRI.

profile_positions.description: On October 3rd 2012, I have defended my PhD-thesis entitled 'Motivating smokers to quit. Effectiveness and feasibility of a web-based multiple computer tailored smoking cessation programme and tailored counseling by practice nurses' (www.phdthesis.nl/eline).
